runs.comm: short of a length, on off, defended by Sharma
swing from Watson, a swing and a miss from Sharma. Short of a length, outside off, Sharma goes for the drive on the up, but the movements beats his bat
big wide down the leg side. Perhaps looking to start too straight with the outswinger
left alone outside off
more movement. Testing conditions here. Sharma looks to drive on the up, and is beaten outside off again
too straight again from Watson. twice this over he has done this, and Sharma nicely glances this away for four to fine leg. Actually this is called leg-byes
back to the line outside off, and Sharma is back to getting beaten by the away movement. Tries the big drive outside off
a pretty ordinary start from Hastings. Length ball on the pads, and Dhawan has whipped this away to fine leg for four
short of a length, on off, driven on the up, but doesn't time it well
short of a length, on off, pushed towards mid-off
short of a length, on the hip, defended to leg
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover-point
walks across the stumps, looking for a big shot into the leg side, doesn't get any timing. Takes the single to midwicket
heavy ball first up, beats Dhawan's pull, hits his thigh pad, goes for a leg-bye
short of a length, hits Sharma's bat high as he looks to punch. No run
another big swing and miss, as Boland stays outside off and just short of a length
more movement, Rohit looks to open the face and is beaten
drops this into the leg side for a single
short of a length, outside off, Dhawan opens up the front leg to pull, but is beaten by the angle across his body
Sharma finally makes a connection, and it is a sweet one. Hastings bowls a gentle length ball outside off, and Sharma crashes this over cover for four
full and straight, whipped away to long leg
Dhawan gets into the act now. The outfield is not slow at all either. Jumps out of the crease, stays leg side of the ball, and cuts a short ball between point and cover-point
that's huge. Dhawan might have hit this into his own house in Melbourne. A length ball on middle and leg, Dhawan clears the front leg, and slogs this over midwicket. Smack off the middle of the bat
moves around in the crease before driving a full delivery deep into the covers
short, around off, slight tennis-ball bounce, Dhawan doesn't repeat the mistake from Adelaide and pulls out of the ramp shot
Sharma gets stuck into Faulkner first ball. Moves across the stumps and ramps a length ball to the flne leg boundary
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of point for one
full, outside off, driven to the right of mid-off for one
Sharma is loving some of the Faulkner medium pace. Another length ball, he gets under it, and drives it over mid-off. He has already made up for the slow start
lovely shot. Touch to go with the earlier power. This is a perfect yorker outside off, but Sharma has steered this between slip and short third man
slower legcutter, but they steal the single. This is dabbed towards the keeper and Dhawan calls Sharma through for the single
thick inside edge as Sharma looks to drive this length ball over mid-off. It falls safely wide of mid-on
extra bounce from Tye from just short of a length. Hits Sharma on the arm as he looks to work it to leg
on a length, pretty straight, drops it at his toes and goes for a single
Sharma looks to play the big pick-up shot on a length ball, and is hit on the pads. Just early into the shot
slower ball, Sharma slogs around it, and is hit in the ribs. They still take a leg-bye
on a length, on off, swiped to mid-on. Straighter of mid-on for one
nice comeback delivery from Faulkner after being taken apart in his first over. Beats Dhawan's drive with some away movement from just outside off
on a length, angling in, defended from the crease
two dots and what does Dhawan do? He dances down the track, and mis-hits a length ball over mid-on. These bats... It nearly goes all the way
lovely shot. A bouncer that follows Dhawan, who arches back, and ramps it over the keeper's head. From the leg-stump line he has sent this straight back
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
slower ball, short, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, goes for a single
short of a length, into the pads, bunted softly into the leg side for a couple. Precise hit. Sends the ball just past the 30-yard circle
high full toss, kept down to short fine leg for one. This is a no-ball then
it doesn't matter where the keeper stands. This is a half-volley free hit, and Sharma has smashed this over long-on for six
flat outside off, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, into the hips, and again he has played this to just outside the 30-yard ring. Takes the second run easily
non-turning length ball, on off, Dhawan rocks back, opens the face, takes the single
gentle full toss, knocked down to long-off for one
flat, short of a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
slows this down a little, dropped into the leg side for one
pushed through, short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
full and straight, Sharma drives it for one. Good over for Australia: just the singles off it
short of a length, into the body, pushed to midwicket
on a length, on off, defended back to him after moving across the stumps
looks to run one down to third man but is beaten by the skiddy pace of Boland
short of a length, no room, dropped at his toes to complete a single
slower bouncer as Sharma dances down the wicket. Hits him on the left shoulder
another slower ball, hits the inside half of the bat, but they sneak in a single to midwicket
big flat six. Maxwell bowls a flat length ball on off, Sharma makes room and sends it sailing over long-off
works this length ball from outside off for a couple into the leg side. Once again he has pushed this just past the 30-yard circle. precise power behind the shot
full, outside off, pushed to long-on for one
down the wicket, takes this on the full and drives it to long-off for one
low full toss, but no room for Sharma to swing his arms. Takes a single all along the ground to long-on

first wicket for Australia. Dhawan tries the reverse-sweep, a shot that is on because the point and third man are inside the circle, but Dhawan has found the man at point. Still doesn't have a fifty in T20 internationals, but a good start for India
some seam movement from outside off and hits Sharma's thigh pad as he looks to work it to leg
short of a length, outside off, and Sharma opens the face of the bat late and places it fine of third man. That brings up his fifty too
full, on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket for one
and Kohli looks in good touch right away. Clips it away off the toes
sharp bouncer, head high, Sharma is beaten on the hook
sharp low full toss, can't really get under it. Driven to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, looking to work this to leg, is beaten and hit on the pad. He is outside the line of off
on a length, outside off, looks to drive this to long-off, but can't place it wide enough of Tye
slower ball, 120ks, driven on the up, straight to short extra cover
good ball, but Kohli has played it just as well. Short ball that follows him and cramps him up totally, but Kohli still manages to guide it towards third man. Fine of third man actually
driven straight to extra cover and Finch fumbles to allow them a single
slower offcutter, runs off the inside half of the bat for a single
slower short ball, late-cut to third man
quicker short ball this time, Kohli looks to play the powerful upper cut, but the extra bouncer beats him
gets the upper cut right this time. Hastings bowls the quick short ball again, but this is a gentler pace. Kohli s ashes it over point
wide length ball. Doesn't matter if it is a slower ball, Kohli has reached it and sent it flying over extra cover. Too much room there
good bouncer, middle and leg, Kohli is ducking and belatedly looks to ramp it. Beaten
down the wicket, is beaten by the slower ball, but he is in such confident mood he recovers and goes ahead with the shot and still manages to chip this over extra cover
Sharma mis-hits this attempted drive down the wicket, but he has gone over extra cover and the ball lands safely
short of a length, wide, late-cut to third man for one
down the wicket and away from the stumps, Boland follows him with a really full delivery. Kohli has no room and manages just the single to long-on

that is a mis-hit that has cleared long-off comfortably. A mix of the short straight boundary and quality of bats. Kohli has withdrawn from the stumps and toe-ended this length ball for a six over long-off
slower bouncer that follows Kohli as he backs away and beats him. A rare dot ball then
good wide yorker, dug out for a single to extra cover
lovely placement again. Kohli jumps out of the crease, doesn't time this shot well, but he has gone over extra cover again, and gets four for it
yorker, doesn't even go off the pitch, but Sharma steals the single
full and straight, driven to long-off for one
slower bouncer, he has pulled this to long-on for one
slower offcutter, Sharma mis-hits a pull, but it doesn't carry to long-on

another run-out between Kohli and Sharma. Low full toss hit towards deep midwicket. Sharma runs back for the second, Kohli doesn't. Easy run-out for Australia. For Sharma it was always two, but Kohli had his hand up right away. Kohli seems to have slipped on the turn, and hence raised his hand in a no
short of a length, hit straight to short straight cover
low full toss, hit to long-on for one
nearly gone first ball. Upper cut from Dhoni, lands to third man on the half-volley. Hastings has to run to his right and then dive to get his body behind this awkward ball
full outside off, driven to deep point for one
Tye might have thought for a moment he has done Kohli in with a wide full ball as Kohli makes room, but he has reached out and steered it past point for four
on a length, on off, punched to long-on for one
slower ball, dragged towards deep midwicket, under pressure to keep them down to one, Maxwell misfields running in from deep midwicket. Easy couple
nearly a yorker, low full toss, mis-hit towards deep midwicket, and because this has gone just past the 30-yard circle at midwicket, they come back for an easy second

recovers well again. Kohli jumps at Boland who seems to have done him in with a wider slower ball, but Kohli's awareness is great. He scoops this square over point for four. Both point and third man are up in the circle
slower short ball, tucked away off the hip for one
hip high full toss, Dhoni loves it, he has sent it over square leg for four. India don't seem happy this is not called a no-ball, but this is not that high
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
goes for the wide ball just inside the tram line. Dhoni lets it go. Not called wide. How cruelly it was called a wide when M Marsh bowled the last over during the SCG ODI
this hasn't taken more than two seconds to reach the boundary. Dhoni sits on the back foot and absolutely smashes this full ball right back at Faulkner. Long-on and long-off have no chance here
smashed again but drags this across to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, drives it in the air towards deep point. Kohli slips at the non-striker's end, which is why they get just the one. Faulkner gives Kohli a hand
flirting with that tram line again, draws a bottom edge from Dhoni on the cut. Goes for just the single
slower bouncer down the leg side, Kohli has hit what would have been a wide for a single to long leg. Faulkner does his job. Only eight off that over

nicely bowled by Tye but what an incredible shot from Kohli to bring up his fifty. He is down the wicket, Tye nearly yorks him up, but Kohli has crunched this past extra cover for four. All along the ground, scorching the turf at it goes
Kohli is down the wicket, is almost done in by a high full toss. Dhoni turns back aggressively, Watson fumbles under pressure at long-off
length ball, hit straight to long-off for one
full and wide goes Tye and Dhoni looks for one of his big hits over long-off, but gets too close to the ball and mis-hits him straight into the lap of long-off

Tye has missed an easy run-out. Hit straight to long-on, and Raina sacrifices his wicket to give Kohli the strike. Maxwell's throw is accurate, Raina is miles away but Tye messes up the collection and gives them the extra run

how can a team display such good awareness one ball and then not even try the second run next ball? Raina was happy to sacrifice his wicket on the fifth ball of the over, but on the last ball - and this is a criticism of perhaps every team in the world - batsmen don't risk hurting their average. This is hit to Maxwell at long-on again, Maxwell has had to collect it with his left hand, but India are happy with just the one. The red ink against the sure is ensured
